abstract_summ: The predominant EEG features in severe Covid-19 are of generalised symmetrical slowing, consistent with encephalopathy . Video-EEG revealed focal monomorphic theta slowing in bilateral frontal-central regions . MRI showed abundant microbleeds located in bilateral white matter junction, various regions of corpus callosum and internal capsule, suggestive of Critical Illness-Associated Cerebral Microbleeds .
